item.title: Self-Hosted NVR Security System
item.description: Picking a Solution Link to heading There are a few different self-hostable NVR software solutions available currently: BlueIris - Windows based NVR software (not free) ZoneMinderFrigate NVR - Opensource NVRs Synology Surveillance Station- Runs on Synology DSM (camera liscense fees) Surveillance Station ended up being the best choice for my use case for a few reasons: Linux based (reliability / security / privacy) Large database of supported devices with native integration into Surveillance Station.

item.title: OPNSense Router from E-Waste
item.description: The Why Link to heading My ISP provided router is terrible, it’s ancient and slow, while also being irreplaceable because of the authentication methods used by my ISP. My new router is ancient and fast, because it is a Dell XPS-8700 desktop. The ISP router still has to be used for IP pass-through, but the XPS handles the firewall, routing, DHCP, DNS, VLANs, WireGuard VPN Server and intrusion detection system (IDS).
